Title: Pharmacists Play Pivotal Roles in Outpatient CAR T-Cell Therapy
Description: Molly Schiffer, PharmD, BCOP, discusses the logistical and operational challenges of delivering outpatient CAR T-cell therapy, emphasizing the benefits of outpatient treatment, including reduced costs, improved access to therapy, and better quality of life for patients.

Title: Machine Learning Shows Promise Predicting Progression of CKD to Kidney Failure
Description: These findings can lay the foundation for the development of machine learning models in chronic kidney disease (CKD) and kidney failure.

Title: Nipocalimab Demonstrates Sustained Disease Control, Reduction in Autoantibodies in Generalized Myasthenia Gravis
Description: Compared with other treatments for myasthenia gravis, nipocalimab demonstrated more significant improvements in disability scores, with tolerable safety.

Title: Genetic Diversity in African Populations Can Advance Precision Medicine Globally
Description: Africa's unparalleled genetic diversity presents both a challenge and an opportunity to advance precision medicine, with a focus on leveraging pharmacogenetics to improve drug efficacy and reduce adverse reactions.

Title: Unveiling the Dark Genome: Targeting Stress-Activated Base Editors to Halt Cancer Progression
Description: Catriona Jamieson, MD, PhD, discusses the role of stress-activated base editors like ADAR1p150 and APOBEC enzymes in cancer progression and highlights innovative approaches to halt these processes and improve therapeutic outcomes.

Title: Study Finds Fasting Plasma Glucose Level Is Associated With Development of Diabetes
Description: Age, body mass index, and male sex are also associated with the development of diabetes.

Title: Aztreonam and Avibactam Receive FDA Approval for Treatment of Adults With Complicated Intra-Abdominal Infections
Description: The decision offers patients with antimicrobial resistance, who have limited or no treatment options, a new alternative.

Title: Quadruple Therapy With Isatuximab Shows Promise for Older Adults With Multiple Myeloma
Description: The quadruple treatment was active and safe as initial therapy for older patients with transplant-ineligible multiple myeloma.

Title: Pharmacists Can Stay Aware of the Evolving Landscape of Gout Treatment to Address Unmet Needs
Description: New therapies are being developed for individuals with gout.

Title: The AQUILA Debate: Daratumumab and Smoldering Multiple Myeloma
Description: Ming-Hei Tai, PharmD, BCOP, shares his concerns about the AQUILA trial and use of daratumumab for smoldering multiple myeloma.

Title: Highest SMM Rates in Pregnant People With Chronic Hypertension and Preeclampsia, Preeclampsia Alone
Description: The prevention of preeclampsia may reduce severe maternal morbidity (SMM) risk in pregnant people.

Title: FDA Grants Fast Track Designation to ADI-001 for Treatment of Refractory Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
Description: The designation builds on previous regulatory action for ADI-001 and allows for expedited development of the treatment for systemic lupus erythematosus.

Title: ABO-101 Receives FDA Orphan Drug and Rare Pediatric Designations for Primary Hyperoxaluria Type 1
Description: ABO-101 is supported by preclinical data that demonstrated significant reductions in urinary oxalate in PH1 disease models.

Title: Video: GLP-1 Medications Revolutionize Obesity and Diabetes Care, With Exciting Advances on Horizon
Description: Donna Ryan discusses the landscape of GLP-1 medications and the lineup of indications that the drug class has received indications for in recent years.

Title: Risk Scores Using Molecular Data Can Better Identify Patients With Primary Myelofibrosis Who Benefit From HSCT
Description: More accurate prognostic risk assessment could aid pharmacists in the management and counseling of patients with primary myelofibrosis.

Title: Gamma Delta T Cells Unlock New Advances in Cancer Immunotherapy
Description: γδ T cells are emerging as a transformative immunotherapy approach in oncology, offering unique mechanisms for targeting hematologic and solid tumors, with clinical trials demonstrating promising survival outcomes and durable immune responses.

Title: Unlocking PROTACs’ Potential: Overcoming Development Challenges
Description: Proteolysis-targeting chimeras hold enormous potential, but also present significant challenges to drug developers.

Title: IVIG Does Not Reduce Late Gadolinium Enhancement Burden in Pediatrics With Myocarditis
Description: Often an indicator of fibrosis or damage to the heart, late gadolinium enhancement was found to be unaffected by the administration of intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) in pediatric patients with myocarditis.

Title: Caring for the Caregiver: Prioritizing Well-Being as a Pharmacist
Description: The demands of the pharmacy profession—long hours, high stress, and emotional strain—can take a toll on pharmacists’ well-being.

Title: Pharmacists Play a Vital Role in Addressing Patient Leakage in the Precision Medicine Care Continuum
Description: Edward Kim, MD, MBA, discusses critical points of patient leakage in precision medicine, emphasizing the role of multidisciplinary teams in streamlining care, managing medications, and improving patient outcomes.

Title: Mindfulness Program Reduces Opioid Cravings During Buprenorphine Treatment
Description: There were no substantial differences for the mindfulness with substance use or anxiety outcomes compared with the recovery control group.

Title: Pregnant Individuals With MS More Likely to Experience Mental Illness
Description: Pregnant individuals with multiple sclerosis (MS) are more likely to experience mental illness both during their pregnancy and in the first years after giving birth.

Title: Dr. Reddy’s enters into collaboration with Henlius for commercialization of HLX15 (daratumumab), a biosimilar candidate to Darzalex® & Darzalex Faspro® in the U.S., and Europe
Description: Dr. Reddy’s gets exclusive rights to commercialize the subcutaneous as well as intravenous formulations of HLX15 in the U.S. and Europe

Title: Research Identifies a Potential Alternative to Mifepristone for Medication Abortion
Description: Ulipristal is a progesterone receptor modulator that prevents pregnancy by blocking the release of an egg from the ovary and inhibiting implantation in the uterus.

Title: Sacituzumab Govitecan Shows Potential in Overcoming Barriers to Brain Tumor Treatment in Patients With Breast Cancer
Description: The Trop-2-tagreting antibody drug conjugate facilitated improved intracranial penetration with favorable tolerability.

Title: Young Adults With Sickle Cell Disease Have Elevated p16 mRNA, Contributing to Premature Aging
Description: Higher p16 expression in patients with sickle cell disease led to heightened risk of age-related complications.

Title: Bridging Gaps in Precision Medicine: Overcoming Patient Leakage and Advancing Personalized Care
Description: Edward Kim, MD, MBA, highlights the challenges of patient disengagement, data fragmentation, and provider education in precision medicine, emphasizing the need for personalized approaches to enhance patient outcomes, particularly in oncology.

Title: American Heart Association Launches Initiative to Increase Education on Heart Failure
Description: The initiative will provide information about care models for specialists and clinical teams to improve patient outcomes in heart failure.

Title: Phase 3 Trial Shows Promising Results for Encorafenib Combination Regimen for Patients with Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
Description: Encorafenib in combination with cetuximab and mFOLFOX6 met its dual primary end point of overall response rate of 61%.

Title: Expert: Abelacimab Shows Significant Bleeding Reduction, Offering Safer Option for Atrial Fibrillation Treatment
Description: Christian Ruff explains the strong efficacy associated with abelacimab compared with rivaroxaban in the AZALEA-TIMI 71 trial.
